C
anuvāta：[m.] a forward or favourable wind.
P

Anuvāta，2 [anu + vā to weave （?） in analogy to vāta from vā to blow] only in connection with the making of the bhikkhus’garments （cīvara） “weaving on，supplementary weaving，or along the seam”，i. e. hem，seam，binding Vin.I，254，297； II，177； IV，121 （aggala +）； PvA.73 （anuvāte appabhonte since the binding was insufficient）. （Page 42）
P

Anuvāta，1 [anu + vā to blow] a forward wind，the wind that blows from behind，a favourable wind； °ṁ adv. with the wind，in the direction of the wind （opp. paṭivātaṁ）. A.I，226 （°paṭivātaṁ）； Sdhp.425 （paṭivāta°）. In anuvāte （anu + vāte） at J.II，382 “with the wind，facing the w.，in front of the wind” anu is to be taken as prep. c. Loc. & to be separated from vāte （see anu A b.）. （Page 42）
